medical_history.chief_complaint: Numbness, paresthesia, and weakness throughout the right hand.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms worsened progressively after a sudden onset 2 months previously. The patient had first felt tingling in the tips of several fingers of his right hand four years before presentation. Carpal tunnel syndrome was diagnosed 8 months prior to presentation, and an endoscopic carpal tunnel release provided only temporary symptom relief.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, and atherosclerotic disease. Seizures noted in past and a family history of seizures (deceased sister).
medical_history.family_history: Deceased sister had a history of seizures. No known neurological symptoms in parents.
